originInfo.publisher: Federal Works Agency, Work Projects Administration

mods.abstract: Mimeographed page contains two original black and white photographs. The top photo is of a woman and two children looking at books in a mobile library. It is identified as the "WPA bookmobile in the Watts Barr [sic] Dam Defense Area covering Rhea, Rhone [sic], Loudon, and Meigs Counties." The bottom photo shows a WPA mobile library parked outside Stewart's Cash Grocery. Children wait in line. The truck is identified as the WPA bookmobile sponsored by the Nashville Public Library. These pictures, between pages 7 and 8, are stapled to the page.
mods.accessCondition: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law.
